title: Skip

Skip
message: To clarify, in Empirica, stage and game are available when the stage starts, not the round. In Empirica v2 (classic), there is one round per stage, not multiple rounds within a stage. Rounds contain stages, but your game may organize them differently. To access the current round, try something like stage.currentRound.

title: Skip
message: In @empirica/core, the Stage object typically has .currentRound on the server side, but not .round. So, when you're working with the API, use the callback parameter { round } or `stage.currentRound`. You can avoid potential issues with undefined by using `roundIndex` from the round. Code snippet: `const round = stage.currentRound || stage.round || null;`.

title: Skip
message: In Empirica, players can join after the game starts. There are callbacks for events like `onGameStart`, `onPlayerJoined`, and `onPlayerCreated`. We can initialize per-player state either when a player joins or at the first stage where the round becomes defined. A safer approach is to use `onGameStart` and lazy initialization when the player is first seen. You can also implement a helper like `ensurePlayerInit` to handle player initialization when needed.

yep! keep the width unconstrained and just center the whole block. use a full-screen flex wrapper + an `inline-block` so the card shrinks to its content. ```jsx export function Introduction({ next }) { return (

Your Tasks

You will be given two tasks. One of these tasks is a gift-exchange game, and the other is an investment game. Which game you play first is decided randomly. You will play 6 rounds of each game, so 12 rounds total, against random other players.

These players are either AI bots or humans that have sent in a photo.

The games are asynchronous - that means that you will make your decisions now, and then the other players will be asked to make their decisions.

Please click next to get started!

); } ``` - `min-h-screen flex items-center justify-center` centers the content both vertically and horizontally. - `inline-block` lets the inner block size to its content (no width classes involved).

title: Skip
message:
gotcha ‚Äî you want that little ‚Äúround‚Äù header chip like the stage screens have, centered above the card. try this: it keeps everything centered (no explicit width constraints), and adds a pill-style round banner above your content. ```jsx export function Introduction({ next, roundLabel = Round 1 of 12 }) { return (
{/* round banner */}
Round {roundLabel}
{/* card */}

Your Tasks

You will be given two tasks. One of these tasks is a gift-exchange game, and the other is an investment game. Which game you play first is decided randomly. You will play 6 rounds of each game, so 12 rounds total, against random other players.

These players are either AI bots or humans that have sent in a photo.

The games are asynchronous ‚Äî that means that you will make your decisions now, and then the other players will be asked to make their decisions.

Please click next to get started!

{/* actions */}
); } ``` - the outer `min-h-screen flex items-center justify-center` centers everything. - the pill (`inline-flex ... rounded-full ...`) mimics a typical Empirica ‚Äúround‚Äù chip; pass whatever you want as `roundLabel` (e.g., `Round ${stage.currentRound.index + 1} of ${game.rounds.length}`) - no width classes added, so it‚Äôll size naturally to its contents.
